v.v: Who is this who comes from Edom, clothed in red from Bozrah?
Why are your clothes red, and why do they look like you have been treading grapes in a winepress?
I have trodden grapes in the winepress alone, and no one from the nations joined me.
For I looked forward to the day of vengeance, and the year for my redemption had arrived.
I looked, and there was no one to help. I wondered that there was none to help,
I trampled down the peoples in my anger and made them drunk in my wrath,
I will tell of the acts of Yahweh’s covenant faithfulness, the praiseworthy deeds of Yahweh.
For he said, “For certain they are my people, children who are not disloyal.”
But they rebelled and grieved his Holy Spirit.
His people thought about the ancient times of Moses.
Where is God, who made his glorious power go with the right hand of Moses,
Where is God, who led them through the deep water? Like a horse running on flat land, they did not stumble.
As the cattle that go down into the valley, the Spirit of Yahweh gave them rest.
Look down from heaven and take notice from your holy and glorious habitation.
Yahweh, why do you make us wander from your ways and harden our hearts, so we do not obey you?
Your people possessed your holy place for a short time, but then our enemies trampled it.
We have become like those over whom you never ruled, like those who were never called by your name.”

v: Who is he in royal clothing, marching confidently because of his great strength?
It is I, speaking righteousness and powerfully able to save.
I trod them in my anger and trampled them in my fury.
Their blood is spattered on my clothes and stained all my clothes.
but my own arm brought victory for me, and my strong anger drove me on.
and I poured out their blood on the earth.
I will tell of all that Yahweh has done for us, and of his great goodness to the house of Israel.
This compassion he has shown us because of his mercy, and with many deeds of covenant faithfulness.
He became their Savior.
he suffered too, and the angel from his presence saved them.
In his love and mercy he saved them,
and he lifted them up and carried them through all the ancient times.
So he became their enemy and fought against them.
They said, “Where is God, who brought them up out of the sea with the shepherds of his flock?
Where is God, who put his Holy Spirit among them?
and divided the water before them, to make an everlasting name for himself?
So you led your people, to make yourself a name of praise.
Where are your zeal and your mighty acts?
Your pity and your compassionate actions are kept from us.
though Abraham does not know us, and Israel does not recognize us,
you, Yahweh, are our father. ‘Our Redeemer’ has been your name from ancient times.
Return for your servants’ sake, the tribes of your inheritance.
